channel.title: Fairly frustrating. port forwarding hates me
channel.description:
so my server wont go on despite hours of effort...Help would be much appreciated. Or at least a hint :3. It is a 317 PI base if that assists anything.
[Edit] I just added an exception in my firewall for port 43594 and it didnt help :|
Client.java [IMG]http://i280.photobucket.com/albums/kk184/50percentelf/pf3.png[/img]
My ports. I did try Utorrent also with no results. [IMG]http://i280.photobucket.com/albums/kk184/50percentelf/pf1.png[/img]
My no-ip [IMG]http://i280.photobucket.com/albums/kk184/50percentelf/pf2.png[/img]
The only thing i think it could be is this [IMG]http://i280.photobucket.com/albums/kk184/50percentelf/pf4.png[/img]

item.title: Fairly frustrating. port forwarding hates me
item.dc:creator: @50percentelf 50percentelf
item.description:
@50percentelf wrote:

Okay so i went onto my neighbors router and port forwarded there and look D: I have Dynex router and at&t. They have linksys :(. In addition i did restart my modem, didnt do anything.

But now i wanna do it on my router so i still need suggestions…It obviously isnt my no-ip cause i can run my server with this.

Read full topic
item.source: Fairly frustrating. port forwarding hates me

item.title: Fairly frustrating. port forwarding hates me
item.dc:creator: @Mikeyzzz Mikeyzzz
item.description:
@Mikeyzzz wrote:

Op:

Its your modem/router its probably a DHCP issue the modem is acting as a router thus it is interfering with the routers port forwarding. I suggest you go read about your modem/router trust me i know this because it’s happened to me before.

Good point, or even just try restarting your modem.

Read full topic
item.source: Fairly frustrating. port forwarding hates me

item.description:

Its your modem/router its probably a DHCP issue the modem is acting as a router thus it is interfering with the routers port forwarding. I suggest you go read about your modem/router trust me i know this because it’s happened to me before.

item.source: Fairly frustrating. port forwarding hates me

item.title: Fairly frustrating. port forwarding hates me
item.dc:creator: @iloveyou12341 iloveyou12341
item.description:
@iloveyou12341 wrote:

[quote=“Aftermath, post:7, topic:421052”]Are you sure it’s a port-forwarding issue? Maybe your no-ip isn’t working.

Try turning your server on and connecting with your client to 127.0.0.1:43594. If this works, the server is running.
Then, go to http://www.whatismyip.com/ and try connecting to the IP it shows on port 43594. If it doesn’t work, it’s a port-forwarding issue. If it works, it’s a no-ip issue.

Also important if you’re using a router: run an ipconfig on the computer the server is hosted on and make sure its network IP really is 192.168.2.3. You might be forwarding to the wrong computer on the network.[/quote]

I can speak for him here as i just spent last 4 hours trying too help him over teamviewer/skype. The problem is very weird. Everything you’ve stated above we’ve tried.

Read full topic
item.source: Fairly frustrating. port forwarding hates me

item.title: Fairly frustrating. port forwarding hates me
item.dc:creator: @Aftermath_961 Aftermath
item.description:
@Aftermath_961 wrote:

Are you sure it’s a port-forwarding issue? Maybe your no-ip isn’t working.

Try turning your server on and connecting with your client to 127.0.0.1:43594. If this works, the server is running.
Then, go to http://www.whatismyip.com/ and try connecting to the IP it shows on port 43594. If it doesn’t work, it’s a port-forwarding issue. If it works, it’s a no-ip issue.

Also important if you’re using a router: run an ipconfig on the computer the server is hosted on and make sure its network IP really is 192.168.2.3. You might be forwarding to the wrong computer on the network.

Read full topic
